intro: Alsodeia scortechinii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed alsike, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, trifoliate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, spike-like clusters, which bloom in early summer. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils. Alsodeia scortechinii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed sites.
